title: Two people are found dead in a house fire in Tamworth
text:
Two bodies, including a five-year-old child, have been pulled from a burning home.

Emergency services were called to Bylong Road in Tamworth at 5.30am on Thursday.

A child and an adult were found dead while a woman was rushed to hospital with burns and a boy, seven, was treated for smoke inhalation.

Emergency services were called to Bylong Road in Tamworth at 5.30am on Thursday. Pictured: The scene

The woman is in serious but stable condition and the boy is stable.

New South Wales Police are treating the fire as suspicious and are investigating if it was started deliberately.

'A man is assisting police with inquiries,' a spokesman said.

Neighbour Bernadette Wood said she knew the victims well and described them as 'lovely'.

'It's so sad... it's a tragedy when your house is on fire, there's nothing you can but stand there and watch,' she told the ABC.

Mrs Wood said she woke up in the night and saw the house in flames.

'Flames were coming out the front window, they were fairly big and there's obviously a bunch of gum trees out in this area,' she said.

Mrs Wood's husband called Triple Zero but help was already on the way.
description: Emergency services were called to Bylong Road in Tamworth at 5.30am on Thursday. A woman was rushed to hospital with burns and a boy, seven, was treated for smoke inhalation.
authors: Charlie Moore For Daily Mail Australia
